intro: Aeglopsis chevalieri, commonly known as the Madagascar starfish plant, is a unique succulent native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often strikingly ornamental species. The plant features a compact, star-shaped rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs. It produces small, star-like flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in late winter or early spring. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in controlled environments to ensure its survival.
